definition: to recover one's youthful vigor/to feel rejuvenated (idiom)

prefix used before the surname of a person or a numeral indicating the order of birth of the children in a family or to indicate affection or familiarity/old (of people)/venerable (person)/experienced/of long standing/always/all the time/of the past/very/outdated/(of meat etc) tough
still/still in progress/still more/yet/even more/in addition/fairly/passably (good)/as early as/even/also/else

sentences.english: Why is robust mouse rejuvenation the quickest route to curing human aging?
sentences.chinese: 为什么小鼠健壮返老还童是治愈人类老化的最快路线？

sentences.english: Wish the elderly rejuvenation and youth forever.
sentences.chinese: 敬祝这些长者们返老还童，永远年轻。

sentences.english: He tried to rejuvenate himself by performing physical exercises each day.
sentences.chinese: 他试图每天进行体育锻炼以使自己返老还童。

sentences.english: Who satis es your desires with good things so that your youth is renewed like the eagle's.
sentences.chinese: 祂用美物使你所愿的得以知足，以致你如鹰返老还童。

sentences.english: So what is going on, have the "oldsters" found the fountain of youth?
sentences.chinese: 到底怎么回事，老兵们难道都找到了返老还童的灵泉？
现在就开始返老还童吧。

sentences.english: That time of your life has past.
sentences.chinese: 你不可能返老还童的，那段时光已经过去了。

sentences.english: ASA guidance states that the use of the term "rejuvenation" is generally unacceptable.
sentences.chinese: ASA规定一般不允许使用“返老还童”这样的字眼。

definition: to seem to grow younger/to regain one's youthful looks
to age/to deteriorate with age/old and weak
to make life longer/to promise longevity/(this product will) extend your life
to rise from the dead (idiom); fig. an unexpected recovery
old but vigorous (idiom); hale and hearty despite the years
effective cure, miracle medicine (idiom); fig. wonder-cure for all problems/panacea/elixir
treasure knife does not age (idiom); old but still vigorous
(of a spirit or deity) to possess sb
